climbs.name: Por La Virgen
climbs.fa: Brad Singer and Pete Paredes, September 2007

content.description: This climbs the steep face right of an obvious crack system and ends below the top. Take care when pulling your rope that it doesn't get stuck on the featured face.

Thin low angle seam in a wide corner leading to a slightly overhung, but short perfect hands crack. Some juggy plate pulling take you to the top.

The beginning was a bit thoughtful with non intuitive climbing/poor hands, and the overhanging crack was steep but absolutely a pleasure to jam.
content.protection:
A small piece in the lower section and a .75 camalot on the crack will get you to the top of this climb safely. I took a standard rack.

Bolted anchors at the top but no rap rings.

Rappelled off brand new anchors lower on route with rap rings. Lower anchors are prior to the plates section just to the right as you finish pulling the overhanging crack
content.location: The climb starts in a bit of a corner of the formation and its surrounding blocks. There is a bolted line to its right.
